title: Perfect small Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This Beach is perfect. Very isolated and not as populated as the other nearby beaches. Perfect for sunrise and sunset to walk with your partner. Waves are not that aggressive and not too many people. I would come again

title: On the Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Our daughter has a condo on the beach here.  She also took a surfing lesson here.  There is a shelf of rocks along the beach in some places, but there are sandy places.

title: Quiet and simple
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Perfect beach for enjoying warm weather and friends. We packed some drinks and ate at a local restaurant for a simple day at the beach.

title: Nice beach for body surfing
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We enjoyed this beach very much. The waves were great and not too strong. My husband and 11 year old son body surfed most of the day. The beach sand was nice and no rocks. Our belongings felt safe on the beach when we were swimming. After swimming we walked to Tamboo and had drinks and a nice meal.

title: Relaxing Beach Visit
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful Beach!  Great for surfers and those who love lots of waves.  Nice place to relax on the beach!

title: Perfect Chill Beach in Rincon
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This is a perfect place to have a chill afternoon on the beach in Rincon. Tamboo Tavern is right on the beach, serving up delicious food and drinks. The beach is even without a big drop off. My husband has traditionally come here every visit for bodysurfing with my father in law. It is a bit more crowded than other beaches in Rincon but not overwhelmingly so. There's also a trailer in the parking lot on the right side of the beach that rents surfboards, chairs, umbrellas, and other equipment.

title: A quiet little piece of Paradise
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Spent a week in Rincon and went to this beach daily. It was never crowded and the surf was great! Everyone had fun playing in the waves.

title: GREAT TIME! AMAZING TOUR GUIDES
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This eco tour was amazing! Beautiful sights all the way through. The tour guides Jose & Omar were very friendly and helpful and very well educated about the waters and caves. I 100% recommend this tour for anyone who is wanting to try it.

title: Gorgeous Beach with Large Waves
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Visited this beach twice during our visit to Rincon. Beautiful setting, supposed to be good for sea glass hunting. The waves were too large for this, but was still a beautiful beach which I plan to visit again. Homes/condos on this beach are beautiful.

title: Surf & Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Another beautiful beach in Rincon.  No resorts or manicured beach here.  No entrance fee & not a crowded beach.  Good for swimming on shallow end, surfing, boogie boarding, beach walking, picnics and more.  If you like sea glass, you can find it on Sandy Beach.  No bathrooms and shower areas.  Although there’s no restaurants on the beach, we had seen coffee shops, gift shops and restaurants along the road.  There’s a store to rent non-motorized water equipment like boogie boards by the entrance in the parking lot.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Absolutely one of our favorite beaches in Rincon! Some days see amazing surf, some days see calm conditions perfect for bathing. If you don’t like the conditions one day, wait a day and they will change. Great beach for laying out. Hopping bars and restaurants line the charming little neighborhood that surround the beach. As long as high N/NE winds aren’t in the forecast, this is the beach to go to!

title: Presidents week in Rincon
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful beach. Beware the surf can be rough for swimmers and this beach is notorious for rip currents. My friends was pulled out several indeed feet within seconds and had a hard time swimming back to shore. Apparently there are several drownings per year at Sandy Beach.

title: Beautiful beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Love Sandy Beach. Does get a little crowded on the weekend so get there early.  Great beach for families

title: I love this beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Hard to go wrong on any beach in Rincon.. surf capital of Puerto Rico.. this beach has the surf and sand and also the jungle at its  edges ... great for shade and also checking out iguanas when you’re not checking out the surf ...also has very cool surfing community all around it

title: Great beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful beach always a nice breeze and you have a bar you can walk to and grab drinks. Use the restroom etc...

title: Beach lover paradise!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon I love the beach and sandy beach made my stay in Rincon. It’s called sandy beach for a reason...the sand is so beautiful and the water is very clear  blue. This is paradise!!! It’s not crowded, just a few people here and there...plenty of space and you can nap without being disturbed. This was like a private beach for us. It was so tranquil. Check it out please!!!

title: Awesome beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon nice and quiet, not too many people.  Almost feels like a private beach.  Take your own chairs and umbrellas.

title: Quiet Small Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon While staying in Isla Verde my husband and I decided to spend the day checking out Rincon. It was about a two hour drive on a Friday. I had researched a few Rincon beaches to check out and Sandy Beach was one of them.  It's not advertised with signage on the road so it was hard to find.  Small parking lot, no one around.  There are houses on the beach so those occupants were around, but that's it. We were approached by a couple guys selling homemade lava cakes, which we bought for $5 each and then were stopped by a guy who ran out of gas and needed money, so we gave him some.  At this point, we took some pics on the beach, drank a few beers then moved on.  I wouldn't waste my time stopping.  We found the downtown public beach had more facilities, a restaurant and not do desolate. Don't get me wrong, we do like quiet beaches with few people like on Vieques, but this one wasn't very appealing.

title: calm beach with rock bottom
text: Sandy Beach Rincon It was a very nice beach with calm waves, when we went in the early morning on Wednesday we were the only people out there for a while. However in the shallow waters the bottom appears to be a flat rock surface which was not my favorite.

title: Lovely for the afternoon
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Perhaps not the most beautiful nor picturesque beach, but a nice place to spend a lazy, relaxing afternoon with friends.

title: Amazing
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Quiet and nice place to love nature. Locals are really friendly and there are a few places walking distance to eat.

title: Meeting friends at the beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Met friends for picnic at the beach . There’s plenty of Americans here to exchange adventures with and get new ideas. But this beach never disappoints and if you get lucky you can find some nice sea glass here as well...

title: Gorgeous
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful beach, gorgeous water, rolling waves.  Make sure you go.  Several entry points along the road.

title: Great waves
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Loved being right on the beach.  Listened to the waves day and night.  Not too crowded, and most days were able to watch surfers.  Saw whales off the shore the first day (3 of them) and none the rest of the week.  Sand near the shore is pretty gravely.  Surf can be rough, but water is nice.  A little drop off when entering the water and waves can make it a challenge to get out

title: Surfer Watching
text: Sandy Beach Rincon When conditions are right, great beach to hang out on and watch surfers “catch a wave”! Tamboo restaurant has a covered deck and a delicious whole Fried Snapper on yummy sauce when available. People watching is also fun on Sandy Beach!

title: Amazing spot
text: Sandy Beach Rincon One of my favorites beaches in Rincon. My boyfriend was looking for good waves so we stopped here. Its a surfer ‘s beach and you can also enjoy a nice walk through the beach and chill. lots of restaurants around the area, many options of food and drinks. Highly recommended.

title: Sandy beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The beach is very sandy with beautiful views.  Nice stretch to walk along as well.  This area is good for surfing.  Not a calm beach if that is what you are looking for.

title: Safe Surfing
text: Sandy Beach Rincon No rocks on the shore and boards are available for rent right on the beach! $25 for 4 hours with is a half day.  Ge there early to rent the best boards.

title: The best
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This was our favorite beach!!  It was sparsely populated and had nice shade trees, a lovely place to spend the day

title: Beautiful sunsets
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great spot for surfers and awesome beach to view a great sunset, walks on the beach and if your a strong swimmer that could work but lots of surfers. Also there’s some good shipping and raw oyster bar plenty to do.

title: Views!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We walked here from our place a couple miles up the beach. We rented the chairs from Rd2happiness which were perfect! Very picturesque and a wonderful way to while away the morning!

title: Great beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great beach for relaxing, but not much for swimming. Beaches are good for surfers so be aware of currents

title: Great for a Beach Walk
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon We visited Oct 2018. The shoreline was beautiful and the sand quite soft for walking. We were able to watch several surfers ride the waves. We were a little disappointed that we didn't get to experience Tamboo on the beach. Tamboo was closed during our visit but was re opening the next week. We likely would have really enjoyed having a meal/drinks on this beach. 

We did take pics/video of our visit. Feel free to check out the footage in our Puerto Rico videos on our channel "Explorcation". Footage includes Sandy Beach and other areas of interest around Rincon.

title: Still love this beach...
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beach was affected by nor’easter. Seems to be More rock and less shore but still beautiful and relaxing.

title: Great for Surfing
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Although not a surfer myself, my kids greatly enjoyed the rougher waters when it came to water sports. Prices negotiable.

title: Beautiful shoreline
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The beach is beautiful, but not for swimming.  The tide is too strong and pulls you.  It is very suitable for dipping your feet in the water and long walks by the shoreline.

title: Nice Stretch of Sand
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon This beach is in Puntas, and is prob the longest beach in the Rincon area.  There are several beach bars and restaurants along the beach.  You can rent surfboards in a few places.  There are also some small shops and food carts. 
The Tamboo Beach Bar is a great place to view the beach and have a beveage & snack.
The beach offers great views of Desecho island and Aquadilla. 
Be careful driving down the narrow roads through the Puntas neighborhoods as you go down to the beach.

title: Sunset dinner
text: Sandy Beach Rincon I was in Rincon last week for a SUP retreat and we ate here one night.  I can't say enough about the view!!!! Definitely get here for sunset.  The food, atmosphere and people were great too!

title: Great sand with shady areas - what more could you want!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Super place to sit, relax and be mesmerized by the waves. We watched the surfers, paddle boarders, those floating on boogie board rented at the head of the beach and those like us who just waded in up to our knees.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy is a great beach to either surf if you are able, or just hang out under the palm trees at the edge. GORGEOUS!

title: My favorite for beach glass.
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy Beach took a bit of a toll after the hurricane but there's still enough beach to walk during low tide.

title: Nice waves
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We are a family that likes big waves. They had big waves this week. I hear most of the time they don’t have big waves this time of the year.

title: Wonderful, secluded beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We stayed in Rincon for 4 days and visited this beach each day and we were often the only ones! The surf was too strong for basic swimming but it was fun to just play in the waves which were often over 6ft. We collected lots of shells and sea glass on this beach. There is an excellent bar/restaurant called Tamboo at the west end of the beach which was just voted #1 bar in the Caribbean! Amazing food and very reasonably priced. Parking is off street but very safe.

title: Beautiful!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We've been here both in summer and winter. In winter, there are lots of surfers and the waves can be rough. In the summer, it's tranquil and calm. Worth visiting in any season.

title: Great beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy beach is a beautiful beach. There are some great little spots to collect shells and sea glass also.

title: Bodysurfing, no board!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon After lunch at the Tamboo, we went climbed down steps to the beach, then went bodysurfing on the breakers.  Great spot! Few people, fewer rocks, warm water, and enough wind.  The waves are frequent, relatively easy to read, irregular enough so that I could catch one further out and get a double ride towards the beach after lurking in (between waves) chest deep water.  On the shore, plenty safe if you stay near the water's edge, which is where children and dogs stayed.

title: Surf trip
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great spot for surfing less crowded than other spots ,pretty easy to get in and out of waves , also great little spot for a family shaded areas laying on the beach or sitting on the beach ,restaurant right ,theres surfboard  rental right there, pretty simple parking

title: Visted after Hurricane and Beach is looking great!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Wife and I just returned from Rincon. Beach was in amazing shape after the hurricane. We had a apartment rented up on hill from this beach and spent most of our time there.

title: Still the Same After Maria
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon During our recent trip to Rincon, we spent one of our days on Sandy Beach.  It's a beautiful, long stretch of sand just north of Rincon, beyond Domes Beach.  The beach seems largely untouched by Maria; it looked much like it did last year.

Sandy Beach is probably better for surfers than swimmers.  Along most of the beach, it's a bit rocky getting into the water.  However, there's one area near the western/southern end of beach that's good for swimming.

title: Great beach to hang out
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We enjoyed the nice beach with plenty of shade.  There was a nice breeze as well.  It was a good spot for the non- sufers to get into the water- not many rocks.

title: OMG LOVE!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Such a cool, beach/surf scene vibe. Great surfing, close to some great bars and a few shops. There's parking too so no problems there.

title: Go, go now.. it’s too beautiful..
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon Everything in this little spot of Rincon is just ideal. Residents are still working though Maria issues - but the hotels, restaurants, activities are so ready for ya. 

Loved the Sushi Pool Restaurant, Rincon Surf School and just about everything we saw & did over the last week. 

Don’t sleep, book the absurdly cheap flight to Aguadilla and you’ll be sipping a Pina Colada and “helping” (really, you are helping by going) in no time..

My walk to pickup my lady at barefoot yoga..

title: Smooth and Fresh
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy bottom at the beach is always a good thing. SO comfy and safe. One of the best beaches in Rincon for the whole family.

title: beach time
text: Sandy Beach Rincon one of the nicer beaches to get into the water  - less rocks makes it more fun!!  kids can have a great time

title: Outstanding surfing!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon This is a beach for surfers, like most of the beaches in Rincón. And this one has waves the height of houses, and sometimes the size of condos. They hold international surf events here, where world class surfers come. This beach is not for beginners! 

And of course, you can take breathtaking photos of the sea, and during the right seasons see humpback whales, or schools of dolphins, as they cross La Mona channel.

title: Stayed at Pelican Point Estates
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We are a group of 7 chaperones and 18 Spanish Club students from a small town in south Georgia. We stayed in this wonderful and spacious place. We loved the view and were right on the beach.

title: Surfed Sandy with  Rincon Paddle boards
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My wife learned to surf on this Beach Begging of April 2017. Nice waves for all levels. Waves were pretty nice and can get pretty big! Great beach!!!

title: Beautiful!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We loved Sandy Beach. It was a 15 minute drive from our condo just south of the town center. It was a beautiful wide beach with interesting rock formations and pretty vistas. I would definitely recommend this beach.

title: Pretty Place
text: Sandy Beach Rincon It is a really nice beach, and the water is incredible, there are a place to eat, get some drinks and listen to music which give it a nice touch, great to hung out and enjoy a pretty beach

title: Good Waves for Surfing
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This is a popular surfing beach but shallow and treacherous for beginners.There is a restaurant adjacent to the parking lot and nice shady areas to sit.

title: Not the best beach for chilling and swimming
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We would recommend the beach next to Black Eagle Marina or Balneario de Rincon for chilling on the beach and doing some swimming.

title: FAVORITE
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Spent many days at Sandy Beach!  Surfing was great, it was quiet and scenic.....took a long walk through a trail from Sandy Beach to Domes.  Saw some horses along the way and there is some cool architectural pieces worn away by the ocean that were amazing!  Some cool swim holes at the beach too.  My adult children had fun climbing on the rocks to get the best view of our surroundings!

title: Great view
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We walked along the shore from the lighthouse to the beach and back. The sun was setting over the Isla Desecheo, surfers were riding the last waves of the receding tide, and pelicans dove for dinner all around us. Delightful!

title: Beautiful beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We walked here one morning and we're the only ones around. It was clean and beautiful. We saw surfers in the distance.

title: Stayed in a condo right on the beach.  Gorgeous beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My son surfed here.  Water is rough for swimming and there is the reef but there is a great spot to get in.  We loved the challenge of the waves but it was not for the faint of heart when we were there. Gorgeous warm water.

title: Peaceful beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy Beach is swimmable and can also have good waves. There are palm trees for shade and food is available as well as drinks.

title: Beautiful spot
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We spent the day at Sandy Beach. It's gorgeous! Showing up with nothing but our hotel towels, we were able to rent a cooler, chairs and umbrellas for close to nothing. We had a great time in the surf and relaxing in sun. At lunchtime we took a short stroll up the beach to Tamboo, sat up on the roof and had a great lunch! it was a perfect day.

title: Beautiful beach w eateries close by
text: Sandy Beach Rincon As it's name says, this is a beach in Rincon with a sand bottom. Many beaches in Rincon are rocky but this one has a more forgiving sandy surface. Tambu tavern is on this beach: an informal restaurant with decent menu and cold beer!

title: great place to surf
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Riptide was really big when we were there so it was great for watching surfers.  You can rent a boogie board or surf board right on the beach.  If you are not a strong swimmer I suggest being very careful.  Ocean floor is rocky (not sandy) so you can get shredded by the current easily if you caught up.  Even just to sit on beach its pretty

title: Place to relax
text: Sandy Beach Rincon When the winds are good its a great place to catch some waves...when the waves are no good then its a great beach to relax and take in the sights.  Great vibe!

title: Sea glass at low tide
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Went at low tide to find sea glass. The parking lot was empty and lots of sea glass in the tide pool. Beautiful sunset!

title: Nice
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon Yes it is sandy long and clean the surfers were catching some nice waves we enjoy the entertainment
If you're looking for a beach  to hang out for a day give it a try

title: Rincon vacation
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful beach, big waves, strong undercurrent. Good for strong swimmers, boogie boards, surfing. Not good for young children.

title: Best windward beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This is the primary tourist beach but is so huge that you never feel crowded or hemmed in.  Several excellent beach side restaurant/bars, plenty of lunch or food sources a block in back of the access road.  Remember to lock that car and leave nothing showing to steal.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Loved this beach - beautiful views and surf.  Careful swimming if the waves are big, there is quite a slope getting out of the ocean. We just relaxed in the shade of the palm trees and waded a little bit.  There are a couple porta-potties near Tamboo Bar which is convenient too, the other beaches we had gone too had no facilities unless you were a restaurant patron.

title: Nice beach but a bit rocky
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Went here to surf, but the waves were too high (supposed to be one of the best surf places in the Caribbean). The beach itself was fine but there are some rocks in the water so important to be careful.

title: Good beach for swimming!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This was a good beach to swim at, and hang out at during the day. It was packed our first day there! There are some rocky areas, but nothing too bad. It is also right next to some restaurants and places to grab a drink.

title: vacation
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The beaches were very rough and rocky and we were not able to swim too much. Our next visit will not be during surfing season.

title: perfect beach for us
text: Sandy Beach Rincon a lot of waves which we had fun with.  nice beach to hang out with space to relax or play in the ocean.  not as crowded as other beaches by san juan

title: Great for first time surfers
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Went to Sandy beach on semi-flat day and a day with 8-10 food waves. Semi-flat day was perfect for first or second time surfers. Rocky bottom but not sharp and it's deep enough where if you do not dive you won't hit bottom. Definitely a fun experience!

title: Mostly sandy. Some rocky bottom.
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We wanted to boogie board here but the beach is very steep and the wave break fast on the beach. The surf wasn't huge but it was very rough with strong currents. On week days you can stroll along, without seeing many people for long stretches. On the weekend it's more crowded.  You can rent surf boards and boogie boards.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Nice sand beach, less rocky than others on the island.  Good for experienced swimmers, surfers, boarders.  Be careful with children as the drop-off is steep.  If you're driving here for the day, aim your GPS for RD2H Ecotours as they're set up in a public (I think) parking area.

title: For surfing and yoga
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Wind facing side,... north. I hope that horse that was getting trained while being ridden bareback finally got over it's fear of the water.

title: Surfs up here
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy beach is a little difficult for new people to find off Highway 413 but worth the investigation.  Beautiful beach and waves while you relax and watch the surfers. Makes for a Great afternoon in the sun.  You have got to drive out there.

title: Beautiful wave-active beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful wave-active beach with beautiful sand and constant temperature of 80 plus degree water and air.

title: Stayed at sandy beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Stayed at pelican point right on sandy beach. Nice clean beach. Would definitely visit again. Fun watching the kids surf during the day.

title: Great waves
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great spot for surfers. Also a good spot just to relax on the beach. Waves might be a little rough some days so precaution must be taken if you want to go in for a swim.

title: Rincon beaches run the gamut from placid days to surfer juggernauts!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon I do not surf! I do love watching surfers though! Wish I had been an aficionado in my youth! I love the laid back no worries vibe in a real surfer's locale. Rincon in general gives off that vibe. The people are as friendly and helpful as any location in the Caribbean I have ever been, and I have been to quite a few!  Unfortunately there had been a storm during our visit (my GF and I) and we had several days of dangerous rip currents. When we got calm days at the end of our trip we took advantage of a glass like sea. We loved our time in Rincon and plan to return. San Juan on the other hand reminded us of rude driving like NYC! OLD SAN JUAN at night was well worth it for the strolling and fine food, That part of San Juan we cherished!!- Kevin Alcock, N.J.

title: Great beach for learning surfing.
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The water becomes deep rather quickly but that's not a problem. The waves have a tendency to carry you along the beach if you choose to swim, which makes this beach better for surfing. Sunbathing is better done in the evening when the sun is shining from a better angle.

title: R AND R
text: Sandy Beach Rincon this beach was Quiet and serene. We watched surfers and families, when we were in the water, we even seen fins, so if you pay attention you might find a little aquatic life. A little crab came out of the sand, if not just to pop his head up to see what was going on, and then he was gone .. Good times.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We walked Sandy Beach one morning during our visit to Rincon.  It was both quiet and peaceful.  It's probably better for surfing than swimming, but will work either way.

title: It's a paradise!!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon I rented a mini apartment in a house called Happiness House
I had an awesome time enjoying the Sandy Beach view, walking around visiting the shop spots, bars and talking with great people from different countries of the USA
Rincon is one of that place that you never leave
Definitively I'll back

title: Beautiful beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We absolutely loved this beach.  Great for surfing and hanging out - lots of sand, great waves and some great restaurants and bars along the strip!

title: Tamboo, Flamboyan, Kahuna, Pelican Point, Casa Islena, Pools bar, Calypso
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon I think the best of the attractions for price and satisfaction are as follows:
Tamboo: drinks and nightlife
Red Flamboyan: Fish, seafood
Big Kahuna: Burgers
Pelican Point: accommodations
Casa Islena: Small dish appetizers
Pool Bar: Sushi
Calypso: Sunset run specials
Surf: Punta Higero and Antonios on Sandy Beach, Marias on west beaches
Weddings: on-the beach weddings
Mar Azul: Surf Board rentals

title: Just beautiful!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Highly recommended for surfing and for swimming and laying out. Some restaurants and coffee shacks walking distance to beach. Love love loved it!

title: 2002-2016 Vacations!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My husband and I have been traveling to Rincon, Puerto Rico since 2002. We have made so many lasting friendships!!! We always look forward to returning every year!

title: Great place for photos
text: Sandy Beach Rincon You're gonna love this place for taking photos, I tried swimming here the other day, but the waves are kinda huge for comfort, so I just sat by the sands and took photos, I love it!

title: Very windy!!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon I don't know if it was just that day we visited. It was so windy. The waves were HUGE!! The beach itself is of course beautiful but definitely not for someone who wants to just chill. It's perfect for surfers but not for the regular beach-goers.

title: Great Waves
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This beach has great waves in the morning. Had an amazing experience at this beach two days in a row.

title: Watch the surfers
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great beach to watch the surfers do what they do best. Take a minute and enjoy the sound of the waves.

title: Worth a trip
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Fun beach to walk!  Was staying in the area and drove over to walk this nice beach..Fun beach bar at the end..not crowded.. Will be back!

title: My favorite
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This place brings so many memories. Great for bodysurfing.  Several restaurants, lodging, and bars nearby.

title: Waves for miles!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The last stop of our trip. What a hidden gem. Beautiful beach with lots of surfers! Loved it! Restaurant and bar close by.

title: Sandy Beach with Surfing swell
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy beach is a great beach in Rincon to wall the beach and swim off of when there are no waves.  BEWARE.. IT IS DANGEROUS when the waves are breaking.  There are dangerous rip-Tide currents in certain areas that one should ask the local beach people about before swimming  while waves are breaking..  Most of the time its great for swimming  with a few rocks here and there to watch out for big waves..  Enjoy your visit to Sandy Beach but be watchfull for big wave days.......

title: Beautiful
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Absolutely beautiful beach, not crowded at all, clean water, quiet and relaxing. We took our kids with us and we all felt very safe.

title: Nice beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon A nice beach, a little less traveled than the Condado beaches by the big resorts.  Clean, with good sand, and a nice decent clientele

title: Great Beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Love this beach.. we went andonly a handful of people there. We were told it was the off sea which was great!

title: Nice sandy beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon No rocks or anything- it was a good beach for swimming and looking for sea glass and rocks.  Not a lot of shade though

title: Nice Place to Surf and Find Sea Glass!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon This was close to our vacation house so it was our first option for a beach when we started our vacation. It isn't really noisy or crowded. There is a small trailer where surf lessons are offered and you can rent whatever board you want. 

There is a beach-side bar down the ways and if you go past that, you can find a little lagoon next to the rocks. It's fun to explore the beach in its entirety too when it comes for searching for sea glass.

title: easy to get to, not good for swimming
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Stayed at a spot near Sandy beach and it was easy to get to and find.  The day we went the surf was rough so it wasn't ideal for wading or swimming, especially for kids.  If you like to park up and just relax with the sound of the ocean on an isolated quiet beach this is a good spot.

title: Spectacular!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon It s a must see! 
Perfect location during day, can turn romantic during night!
Parking available and free.
Clean beach, fit for kids too.

title: Sufing all day, Tamboo for lunch
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great place to surf for beginners in the summer.  Learned from the best, Albert and Nathan at RD2H.  Rental chairs and umbrellas available. Surfed in the morning then lunch at Tamboo during the storm!

title: Not my favorite beach on the island
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beach was the closest to the house we were staying in.  Not my favorite beach on the island as it had a steep drop off and waves crashing close to shore.  We did see a turtle nest excavation while we were there so that was interesting.

title: Clear water, clean sand and quiet
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We enjoy walking here everyday to simply play in the ocean. It's typically quiet u less it's a holiday weekend, which we love. Kids learned to surf here too.

title: LOVE THIS BEACH
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Our second visit to PR and still our favorite beach in Rincon! Watch out because the waves can get crazy in October-April. Look for sea glass and see what all you can find!

title: Very nice Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This is a very nice Beach to go to if you like to serve it can get very good I'm glad that it's a nice day just to relax on there are some good places in the area to have lunch or dinner and some cold beers

title: Great beach!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful, wide, and clean. The beach was just steps from our house and very convenient. 

We spent a lot of time on the beach during our stay. It was perfect for going for walks or just splashing around. 

It wasn't a great wading beach due to the reef and the current that ran along shore. It was a little too rough for the youngest (3, 4, and 10) in our parties to really enjoy. 

Convenient (and good!) bar and restaurant located right on the beach, The Tamboo. 

Gorgeous sunsets!

title: Super great
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My family and I spend the day in Sandy Beach and the Tamboo place and it was excellent. The beach is great for surfers and for the complete family. Be carefull always with the kids and old fulks because of the waves. Super nice beach to suntan and for turtles nesting, so be carefull.

title: great family beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This beach is lovely for swimming and sunning in the summer. Shade is not as accessible as some of the other beaches so you might want to bring an umbrella.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Enjoyed this beach while relaxing and taking surfing lessons with our family. Breathtaking views. Can't wait to return!

title: Very sandy beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon nice beach to surf and chill on the sand. not very good for kids... but otherwise its a clean water area good to have fun.

title: lovely
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Lovely swimming beach when we went in June. Even some decent snorkeling.  Nicely maintained yet not commercialized.  Not too crowded, even on weekends.

title: SANDSAYSIONAL
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Felt like a local every time i returned. Sugar type sand, the waves are the highlight, crashing rocks or curling in the reflective light kissing the sand as they come in.. The only beach that has a feel of private remoteness yet there's an eatery and rental place at hand, strange yet satisfying. No crowds just surf sun and solitude!  Come get acquainted!

title: Simply Beautifu
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My family, friends and I really enjoyed ourselves at Sandy beach. The views are simply breath taking! Love it very much!

title: great beach with great restaurants and bar next door.
text: Sandy Beach Rincon There is plenty of parking during the week. It gets a little crowded over the weekend. Go to the beach early!

title: Sandy beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon My wife and I took a ride to this beach it was beautiful lots of sea glass and surfers lots of restaurants and people. The only thing is getting there hard to find use your gps or you will get lost

title: Beautiful
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful, quiet beach. Favorite beach in PR, there is an awesome beach bar/restaurant on it too. The beach had small little bumps to surf, they also have a small shop where you can rent boards.

title: Beautiful Beach with a nice surf and restaurant!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Many of the beaches we visited in Puerto Rico were filthy, but not this one!  The beach was clean, the waves were just strong enough that the whole family could get up on a board (my eight year old son rocked it) and there was a lovely restaurant with food that was pretty darn good.  Definitely go here if you are in Rincon!

title: Fun to walk and find sea glass, beautiful views, better for surfing than swimming.
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The views on this beach are beautiful. You need to be careful because it has a lot of rocks and coral under the water. The river mouth is where you will find more sea glass, and it is usually best after storms, you can look through the area where there are shells and the glass will be within there. The rays of the sun on the water were picturesque. I went in May and for a lot of my walk I had the beach to myself which was very cool!

title: Good beach for surfers but not paradise for swimmers
text: Sandy Beach Rincon A lot of surfers but there is a reef directly on the beach so it is kind of dangerous for swimmers.not a big beach and not many possibilities to find some shadow..anyway the water is okay

title: Coolest beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Great fun for surf watching, sunning or just walking.  Swim at your own risk, but fabulous.  If you only see surfers stay out of the water unless you have your own board.  Food in the area is also worth.

title: Beach Vacation
text: Sandy Beach Rincon First visit to West Coast. Beautiful beach but sand is not as soft as others meaning bigger grains. Sand gets extremely  hot during day for walking. Great for families not looking for calm, glass like beach. Best spot is right by Tamboo for the shade, music & drinks. Kids are 13 & 11 and the locals got my kids interested in surfing.

title: lovely walks and swimming on Sandy Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Good food at Tamboo Tavern, be careful of the surf.  Still able to find beach glass.  Ocean pools safe for children.

title: Beautiful
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Although we did not try surfing, we really wish we did!  This beach was beautiful, and it was so fun to watch surfers of all different ability levels out there giving it a try.

title: Best swimming beach in Rincon
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Only location where it is not rocky to swim, sandy beach located by tamboo is best location to enjoy smooth suntan with calm beach to take a dip.

title: Relaxing beach day
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon On March 28, 2016 my partner and I decided to take a beach day. We went to Sandy Beach. Discover a quiet corner and made our camp!
There are many people, locals and tourist. The beach was clean and the waves calm. 
Unfortunately, the afternoon showers appears and have to go to other place.

title: Good for beginner surfers
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Being one of the few mostly sand bottom beaches, this is a good place for beginner surfers. Surf lessons are offered here and the instructors are very nice!

title: Family retreat
text: Sandy Beach Rincon The hotel had great location, espectacular views  food was good and service too. We stayed at Tamboo's. The beach is great but you better know how to swim. Friendly people.

title: Beautiful, laid back and friendly
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Sandy Beach is the kind of beach that decompresses the soul.  Chill on the sand, rent a surfboard, go snorkling, or hang out with a Medalla on the deck at Tamboo.  So easy.

title: Wide and windy!!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon A lot of surfers hit sandy beach. It is on the north side of the island and just about 15 minutes north of Rincon. There are some nice local shops tucked in along the beach. The prevailing wind tends to come out of the north east and so this beach gets the big wind. As a kite flyer I love it!! Not a great swimming beach because there are a lot of waves and it can be rough. But it's a great place to watch surfers and hang out on the white beach.

title: Sandy Toes
text: Sandy Beach Rincon When we went the water was a little rough but was fun watching surfers. Great for long walks on the beach.

title: Absolutely Beautiful!!!
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon The beach was amazing! We found a spot by a surf board rental shop and parking was free! The water is crystal clear! Must see!! 

There were also mango trees on the way and we picked a couple of them. :)

title: Great beach and surf spot
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We surfed here a few days while we were on an epic surf trip. The beach is great and family friendly. There is food right there and parking was tricky. One of my favorites on the trip!

title: Nice !!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We stayed Right across the Street !!!  So Beautiful !!! Third time in Puerto Rico... Want to Live Here !!!

title: loved it!!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon really beautiful beach, while my boyfriend surfed i was just relaxing on the sand and i what i liked a lot of this beach is that i could get in into the water. And you got Tamboo in front of the beach which is a really nice bar to hang out.

title: love this beach!
text: Sandy Beach Rincon This beach was amazing great beginner surfing. The beach was sandy with a large beach front area and lots of restaurants.

title: Beautiful
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Beautiful beach. Get there early and collect your sea glass. Chair/umbrella rental available from trailer in main parking lot.

title: Beautiful Sandy Beach
text: Sandy Beach Rincon We hiked to Sandy Beach from Domes thru the trails and along the beach. It was isolated and beautiful.

title: Nice area but somewhat isolated from the town of Rincon, so think twice before you stay here.
text:
Sandy Beach Rincon Beach area north of Rincon by about 10 minutes, up the somewhat harrowing (ie narrow, steep and windy ) 413 and then you need to turn left either just before or after the Lazy Parrot ( and back down the hill ) to get there.  Casual and surfer-friendly.

Quite a few places to stay but not that convenient if you're heading back and forth to town ( due to the route ). 

It's obligatory to check out Tamboo for lunch, dinner or the nighttime bar scene.

title: Fun area
text: Sandy Beach Rincon Loved loved loved Rincon. Cute little area where you can sit on the beach and enjoy the view of the surfers! Sandy beach is the best area to stay in my opinion.
